description: In Amazon Kindle, readers can take notes, make highlights, and leave bookmarks in eBooks they are reading. If the eBook is an AZW3 file, Kindle will save the reader's notes, highlights, and bookmarks in an accompanying AZW3R file.

AZW3R files are saved in the same directory as the AZW3 file with which they are used. Typically, this is in Kindle's .sdr sub-directory. While AZW3R files are not meant to be opened by users, some users have created utilities that allow them to extract the notation AZW3R files contain.
